summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to defense attorneys regarding the logistics of providing the first discovery production in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It details the need for physical hard drives to transfer approximately 12 GB of data and includes a specific request for a drive to be sent to Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

keyFacts: The first discovery production in the Epstein case was approximately 12 GB of data.
The prosecution required physical hard drives (not thumb drives) to transfer the discovery data to the defense team.

A specific request was made to provide a hard drive for Jeffrey Epstein to review the discovery while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), indicating he had ongoing access to his legal case materials.
The correspondence confirms active pre-trial proceedings and evidence sharing in July 2019, shortly before Epstein's death in August 2019.
